1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:22): They're really really simple once you've got everything else done.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:22): they're hard to implement actually
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:22): common graphics libraries don't support them directly
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:22): Really?  It took me like 5 minutes to do them once I got circle and oval working.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:23): Most of it was just trying to figure out the filledRectangle syntax.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:23): we don't draw gradients with a lot of rectangles
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:23): we pass them down
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:24): to various native libraries
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:24): just started from the bottom.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:24): I suppose we could approximate squares etc with linear gradients and clipping
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:24): Hmm, maybe that'll work.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:25): you really want them implemented as close to the graphics hardware as possible, for performance
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:25): (gradients in general, I mean)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:25): That won't help us solve the 7th gradient-shape I wanted, though - box (shape of the box, taking into account border-radius).
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:26): Though, to be honest, that's not as useful now that I don't skew the gradient.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:26): we should define a new SVG Filter for that
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:26): I really just have no idea what can be done with SVG.  I need to learn up on it.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:27): with feMorphology erode/dilate you can kind of approximate the effect
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:30): the only bit of heroism I'm considering is adding -moz-repeating-linear-gradient and -moz-repeating-radial-gradient, since they'd be really easy

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:39): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: Also, I assume that -moz-repeating-linear-gradient(red -10px, blue 50px) repeats with a 60px period?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:40): Hmm.  Is that equivalent to linear-gradient(red -10px, blue 50px, red 110px, blue 170px, ...)?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:40): red -10px, blue 50px, red 50px, blue 110px?
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:40): it's equivalent to linear-gradient(red -10px, blue 50px, red 50px, blue 110px, ...)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:40): That makes better sense.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:41): so you get an abrupt transition when the starting and ending colors are not the same
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:41): but I think that's OK, it's pretty obvious what to do to get a smooth transition there
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:41): Yeah, and I can put an example in the spec for it too.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (01:41): and you might want the abrupt transition
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:43): I guess sure.  Possibly more in radial - I dont' think I'd ever want it to be abrupt in linear.  But there's no reason to prevent it.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:02): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: a couple more questions, if I may trouble you...

042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:02): "In certain circumstances it is impossible to determine an appropriate ending-shape from the given parameters; in these instances the gradient image is just a solid color, defined by the last color-stop in the list. The following combinations of values will trigger this: closest-side  if the starting-point is on a box edge, closest-corner if the starting-point is on a box corner, ellipse and closest-corner  if the starting-point is on a box-edge,"
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:03): in those situations, the shape is simply a circle/ellipse with radius 0, isn't it?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:03): Which is also "a solid color, defined by the last color-stop in the list".
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:03): ok, I suggest you rephrase "it is impossible to determine an appropriate ending-shape" then
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:03): there' nothing really inappropriate about an empty circle or ellipse
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:04): Well, it's sort of a degenerate circle.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:04): Equivalent to a point.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:04): Depending on who you're talking to, degenerate shapes aren't valid.  ^_^  I'll rephrase it, though.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:04): "and finally ellipse and either closest-corner  or closest-side if the starting-point is outside of the box."

042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:05): I don't think we need to call out degenerate shapes in the spec, unless the spec demands behavior for the degenerate shape that is different from what you would get applying the normal rules
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:06): That last one really is an error, though.  There's no way to determine the dimensions of the ellipse in that case.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:07): suppose I'm using closest-side
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:07): Unless you extend the lines defined by the sides outside of the box, I guess.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:07): You can attempt to infer that, but I don't say anything that would make that required.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:07): I dunno if it's useful
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:07): but it's what my code does
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:08): I'll have to add extra code to detect the outside-box case to match the spec as written
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:08): Yeah, I had to do so as well (my code didn't gracefully handle it, so it was required anyway).
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:09): so I suggest changing the spec to make that the behaiour
